page.title: 07THE VILLAGE HALL CHADDESLEY
page.content: The Village hall was built in 1894 as a village Institute. Over the years it has been rebuilt, extended, and modernised. There are about 480 bookings each year. The hall is used for Brownies, Guides, Woman's Institute, Conservatives, Football Club, Farmer's Club,Playgroup, Over Sixties, Craft Classes, Church Committee meetings, Wedding Receptions, Social Evenings, Luncheon Parties, Children's Parties, Wine and Cheese parties, Discos, Jumble Sales and Exhibitions. There are many social events each year together with plays and the occasional pantomine. There are many fund raising events to help maintain the property and keep it clean and attractive. The Parish Coucil give a grant each year to assist with the upkeep.
